p: The education level of the farmer positively influenced the household decision to adopt livestock insurance, allocate more area for fodder, and to migrate as a strategy to mitigate the adverse effects of climate change. Land holding and land entitlement was positive and significant for the adoption of livestock insurance and allocation of more area for fodder, while negative and significant for selling of livestock and migration, highlighting that farmers with larger land holdings and landowners mostly adopted livestock insurance and allocated more area for fodder because of their affordability. Poor farmers tended to either sell livestock or migrate to cope with the climate risk.
